|availability = UK only |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = 08/2010 |price = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 606449070989 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |country = China
|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The device has been released ('''Virgin Media''' branded) in the UK only.
This device makes use of AR7010's mass storage mode (and an onboard 8 MB '''Macronix''' SPI Flash <small>[MX25L6445EM2I-10G]</small>) to provide automatic driver+utility installation in Windows. :For use in Linux, the mass storage device (USB ID: 0cf3:20ff) must be ejected before the actual device (USB ID: 0846:9018) is recognized.. however, any recent version of '''ath9k_htc''' should handle this.
"YTU20-RA-1.0" is silkscreened on the board in the images below. :A date code of '''1048''' (Dec. 2010) is silkscreened on the back of the board w/ the PCB manuf. info. The device's EEPROM has the regdomain set to 0x65.
{{WiFiCert|WFA9657|08/03/2010}}
